kenticocommunity.qandaanswerdata.QAndAAnswerDataContent:
This is a fantastic post, Sean. Not just for Kentico developers, and not just for 'back-end' developers, but any developer working with AI on a reasonably complex project where context is important.
Sure, trying to 'one-shot' a web app as an experiment is one thing, but in the real world, we find ourselves working in larger codebases, with integrations to various systems, following patterns for team development, and having to maintain quality and best practices. You wouldn't expect a human to just dive in and write perfect code without being onboarded to a project and codebase. So onboard your AI!
